thread.title: Detroit Tigers rookie Daniel Norris, traded for David Price, announces he has thyroid cancer
thread.title_full: Detroit Tigers rookie Daniel Norris, traded for David Price, announces he has thyroid cancer

author: Jen McCaffrey | jmccaffr@masslive.com
title: Detroit Tigers rookie Daniel Norris, traded for David Price, announces he has thyroid cancer
text:
Detroit Tigers rookie Daniel Norris, traded for David Price, announces he has thyroid cancer Daniel Norris Detroit Tigers starter Daniel Norris (44), delivers a pitch during the first inning of a baseball game against the Chicago White Sox Sunday, Oct. 4, 2015 in Chicago. (AP Photo/Paul Beaty) (Paul Beaty) Comments 
As the Toronto Blue Jays battle the Kansas City Royals for a spot in the World Series, one of their former rookies is fighting a much more important battle against cancer. 
Detroit Tigers lefthander Daniel Norris announced on his Instagram page today that he was diagnosed with thyroid cancer this summer while in the Toronto Blue Jays organization before his trade to the Tigers. 
Norris was the top prospect (along with Matt Boyd and Jairo Labourt) who was traded to Detroit in exchange for ace starter David Price at the trade deadline. 
In the post, Norris said he opted to wait until the end of the season to have surgery. 
In 13 major league starts between Toronto and Detroit this season, Norris posted a 3.75 ERA with 45 strikeouts and 19 walks. A photo posted by Daniel Norris (@danielnorris18) on Oct 19, 2015 at 1:59pm PDT
